Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Isolation \I`so*la"tion\ ([imac]`s[-o]*l[=a]"sh[u^]n), n. [Cf. F. isolation.] The act of isolating, or the state of being isolated; insulation; separation; loneliness. --Milman. [1913 Webster]

isolation n 1: a state of separation between persons or groups 2: the act of isolating something; setting something apart from others [syn: {closing off}] 3: a feeling of being disliked and alone 4: preference for seclusion or isolation [syn: {reclusiveness}] 5: (psychiatry) a defense mechanism in which memory of an unacceptable act or impulse is separated from the emotion originally associated with it 6: a country's withdrawal from internal politics; "he opposed a policy of American isolation"
